title: What exactly is going on?
body:
So hello guys, i am just hoping for some answers here because i really dont know what to say after my last ranked game.
Well i ask you to check his games in the link above and below where i got a teammate who picked jinx as support with tele/heal.. i mean whatever it wasnt about that. At first me and my teammates decided she was inting and trolling and then left the game but after some research i saw that this was indeed her first ranked game, all other games before that were BEGINNER games i will repeat BEGINNER.
So the question is the following, was that a bug in the system or Riot is currently testing me if am about to crack, because currently i am under a chat restriction.
Thanks a lot i hope to hear some opinions on this one.

EDIT : Actually it will be better if i just give you his op.gg 
<Removed By Moderation>

replies.body:
This just perfectly demonstrates how the matchmaking system works.

It's pure bad luck on your side, I feel sorry for this. If you want to play games with better matchmaking go for Dota or HoTS. In LoL you get this....

At least she has 95% winrate, kappa :D

Yeah man i am pretty sure that 100% winrate is what tilted her after being 0/5 at 6 min to go afk lol.
Still i prefer to think that i am being punished for my bad behaviour in the past that to believe that with a gold 5 mmr i play with players that just finished playing with bots.. I mean if that's the case it's hopeless
I think Rito explicitly stated that they do not give this kind of "prisoner's island" like punishment, so it has to be the matchmaking, sadly :\

Hey there. I've removed the link from your post. We have rules against naming or shaming here, regardless if someone is guilty of something or not, and in this context, it's considered as such.

That being said, players are fully within their right to start playing ranked whenever they feel like they're ready, and they're allowed to pick whatever champion / summoner spells they'd like to use, as well as build whatever they want. As long as they're actively trying to win the game and aren't intentionally trolling their team / exhibiting toxic behavior, no rules are being broken.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding this moderator action, please visit us in the [Moderation Discord Server](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification). If you'd like to leave us feedback on our moderation or the boards in general, please make a thread in the ["Discuss The Boards"](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board.

Thanks for the reply so i have just one question;
You said " As long as they're actively trying to win the game and aren't intentionally trolling their team / exhibiting toxic behavior, no rules are being broken." Well after dying 5 times at 6 min the unnamed player left the game, isnt that breaking the exact rule you mentioned?

I just wanted to provide you with some information regarding what is and isn't acceptable in game. Generally yes, feeding and leaving can fall under the category of toxic behavior. That being said, I'd like to point out that it's entirely possible that the feeding was unintentional and they left out of irritation for performing poorly. That isn't to say that it wasn't intentional, but it's definitely a possibility. If you suspect the feeding was intentional, all you need to do is report them using the after-game report system (and leaving games is also report-able).
